poem:
"Interactions of Life and Death"

In the dance where nerve greets muscle,
A minuet of life and decay,
Marion charted the clumsy waltz - 
A bleak ballet, yet she walked its every step.
Glasgow to Newcastle; life's scientific way-setters.
Her words, whispers of pain, are now silent,
Yet in her wake, the echoes of understanding,
Speak louder against the stillness of the lab.
